measured_by: 4-item financial scarcity index (items ppl10018, ppfs0684, ppfs0679, ppfs0680)
justification: "To assess perceived material scarcity, we used an index of the following items… All four items were standardized prior to averaging and showed acceptable internal consistency (α = .73)."

measured_by: 3-item time scarcity index (items ppl10008, ppl10009, ppl10012)
justification: "To measure perceived time scarcity, we used an index of the following items… All three items were standardized prior to averaging and showed good internal consistency (α = .81)."
"To measure preference for familiarity, we used the following three items… Although we had planned to combine these items into a single index…"

measured_by: Liking ratings of familiar vs unfamiliar given names (1–7 scale)
justification: "Participants rated how much they liked eight female given names … All names were rated on a scale from 1 (=dislike) to 7 (=like)."

measured_by: Liking ratings of familiar vs unfamiliar surnames (1–7 scale)
justification: "Participants rated … eight surnames (four familiar, four unfamiliar)… rated on a scale from 1 (=dislike) to 7 (=like)."

measured_by: Valence ratings of nonsense syllables with varying association levels (1 bad – 7 good)
justification: "Participants also rated how good or bad they thought the meanings of twenty-four nonsense syllables were… on a scale from 1 (=bad) to 7 (=good)."

measured_by: Bet choice task between familiar and unfamiliar given names
justification: "Participants were presented with three pairs of bets… each pair contained one familiar and one unfamiliar name… Which three do you choose?"

measured_by: Fruit selection task (choice of familiar vs unfamiliar fruits)
justification: "Participants indicated how many of each fruit they wanted… apples and bananas as the more familiar fruit and oranges and peaches as the less familiar fruit."
